post.content:
Quoted


\\" As far as your question with regards to interviewing - the best thing the candidate can do is listen carefully to the person interviewing him/her. They may discuss what the main skills the company is looking for - The candidate should highlight his/her experience regarding those skills (top 2 or 3 skills she can discuss).

Obviously, she will not know the skills the other candidates have but if she presents herself to be the \\"best qualified\\" for the position, it will be helpful.

The other thing a candidate should do is to try to \\"stand out\\" so the people interviewing him/her will remember him/her and want to see the candidate again for a second interview.

The candidate should also try to be confident of themselves and their skills - but try NOT to be TOO confident that they \\"turn off\\" the people interviewing them. \\"


Quoted from a memo by James Lee at W5
post.title: Interview Tip
